abstract: A new report suggests that majoring in science, technology, engineering or math might pay off after graduation.
snippet: A new report suggests that majoring in science, technology, engineering or math might pay off after graduation.
lead_paragraph: Over at The Times's Economix blog, Motoko Rich reports today on a new study from the Georgetown University Center on Education and the Workforce that indicates that college students might do well to study science, technology, engineering or math.

headline.main: Report Supports the Practical Value of STEM Diplomas
